citations.refer_text: The CSP has two types of constraints: (i) x ∈ w(p) for each node x labeled with predicate p ∈ P; and (ii) xj = yj0 (the j-th component of x must equal the j'-th component of y) for each edge (x, y) labeled with j0j ∈ R. A solution to the CSP is an assignment of nodes to values that satisfies all the constraints.
